courses.title: Introduction to Science for Grade 4
courses.shortDescription: Learn the basics of natural science with fun activities.
courses.longDescription: This course introduces Grade 4 students to the wonders of science through engaging experiments and simple explanations about matter, energy, and ecosystems.

courses.title: Mathematics Basics for Grade 2
courses.longDescription: A fun-filled course for young learners to understand numbers, addition, subtraction, and basic geometry concepts through games and real-life examples.

courses.title: English Skills for Grade 5
courses.shortDescription: Boost your English reading and writing.
courses.longDescription: Designed for Grade 5 students, this course focuses on building vocabulary, grammar, reading comprehension, and writing simple essays through interactive activities.

courses.title: Geography for Grade 8
courses.longDescription: This course takes students on a journey around the world to learn about continents, major rivers, oceans, and global climate patterns with fun map activities.

courses.title: Physics Basics for Grade 10
courses.shortDescription: Fundamentals of forces, motion, and energy.
courses.longDescription: Learn the basic principles of physics including force, motion, work, and energy with real-world examples and experiments explained in simple terms.

courses.title: Computer Skills for Grade 6
courses.shortDescription: Basic computer operations and typing skills.
courses.longDescription: A beginner-friendly course teaching students the basics of using computers, typing skills, file management, and internet safety tips.

courses.title: Chemistry Essentials for Grade 11
courses.longDescription: An intensive course covering chemical equations, molecular bonding, and the periodic table essentials for Grade 11 science students.

courses.title: Social Studies for Grade 7
courses.longDescription: Students will explore major civilizations, ancient societies, and world religions with engaging storytelling, interactive activities, and quizzes.

courses.title: Biology: Cells and Systems for Grade 10
courses.shortDescription: Study cells, tissues, and human body systems.
courses.longDescription: An exciting introduction to biology that covers cellular structure, plant and human tissues, and body systems for high school beginners.

courses.title: History of Egypt for Grade 9
courses.longDescription: This course guides students through the fascinating history of Egypt, from the pharaohs to the present day, with maps, timelines, and visual documentaries.

courses.title: Philosophy and Logic for Grade 12
courses.shortDescription: Learn critical thinking and logic foundations.
courses.longDescription: Teaches students how to think logically, reason critically, and analyze arguments systematically, preparing them for university-level thinking.

courses.title: Arabic Reading Skills for Grade 3
courses.shortDescription: Enhance your Arabic reading and comprehension.
courses.longDescription: Aimed at Grade 3 students to strengthen their Arabic reading comprehension, vocabulary, and storytelling skills through fun exercises.

students.name: Guy Hawkins
students.comment: I appreciate the precise short videos (10 mins or less each) because overly long videos tend to make me lose focus. The instructor is very knowledgeable in Web Design and it shows as he shares his knowledge. These were my best 6 months of training. Thanks, Vako.

students.name: Dianne Russell
students.comment: This course is just amazing! has great course content, the best practices, and a lot of real-world knowledge. I love the way of giving examples, the best tips by the instructor which are pretty interesting, fun and knowledgable and I was never getting bored throughout the course. This course meets more than my expectation and, I made the best investment of time to learn and practice what I am passionate about. Thank you so much to our excellent instructor Vako!! Highly recommend this course! Take the next step.

students.name: Eleanor Pena
students.comment: I appreciate the precise short videos (10 mins or less each) because overly long videos tend to make me lose focus. The instructor is very knowledgeable in Web Design and it shows as he shares his knowledge. These were my best 6 months of training. Thanks, Vako.

lesson.courseTitle: Complete Website Responsive Design: from Figma to Webflow to Website Design
lesson.lectureDescription: We cover everything you need to build your first website. From creating your first page through to uploading your website to the internet. We’ll use the world’s most popular (and free) web design tool called Visual Studio Code. There are exercise files you can download and then work along with me. At the end of each video I have a downloadable version of where we are in the process so that you can compare your project with mine. This will enable you to see easily where you might have a problem. We will delve into all the good stuff such as how to create your very own mobile burger menu from scratch learning some basic JavaScript and jQuery. If that all sounds a little too fancy - don’t worry, this course is aimed at people new to web design and who have never coded before. We’ll start right at the beginning and work our way through step by step.
